tool.help:
.. image:: ${static_path}/images/tools/frogs/FROGS_logo.png :height: 144 :width: 110
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
What it does
Extract the highly variable ITS1 and ITS2 subregions from ITS sequences.
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
Context
As the inclusion of parts of the neighbouring, very conserved, ribosomal genes (SSU, 5S and LSU rRNA sequences) in the sequence identification process can lead to severely misleading results, ITSx identifies and extracts only the ITS regions themselves.
If the ITS1 or ITS2 region is not detected, the observation is discarded.
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
Inputs/Outputs
.. class:: h3
Inputs
**Sequence file**:
The sequences (format `FASTA <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FASTA_format>`_).
**Abundance file**:
The abundance of each cluster in each sample (format `BIOM <http://biom-format.org/>`_).
.. class:: h3
Outputs
**Sequence file** (itsx.fasta):
The sequence file with only ITS1 or ITS2 part (format `FASTA <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FASTA_format>`_).
**Abundance file** (itsx.biom):
The abundance file with only ITS sequences (format `BIOM <http://biom-format.org/>`_).
**Summary file** (report.html):
This file presents the number of removed observations (format `HTML <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTML>`_).
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
How it works
.. csv-table:: :header: "Steps", "Description" :widths: 10, 90 :class: table table-striped
"1", "Predict positions of the ribosomal genes in the sequences (`ITSx <http://microbiology.se/software/itsx/>`_)." "2", "Remove the sequences without prediction of the targeted ITS region (ITS1 or ITS2)"
